plaintext:
> What about the level of self-esteem for my child, the belief that I can and love
myself? Is my child a child with low self-esteem? A child with high self-esteem?
Take a closer look at the characteristics of a child with high self-esteem and
think about what kind of child you are!
Child with high self-esteem
As discussed in the previous post of people with high esteem
[/people-with-high-self-esteem/], the characteristics of people with high were
listed and now we will look child with high self-esteem through and through in
this post.

What about the level of self-esteem of your child? Is your child a child with
high or low self-esteem? Is it a high child? Take a closer look at the
characteristics of a child with high self-esteem and think about what kind of
 your child is. 

Photo by Limor Zellermayer
[https://unsplash.com/@limorganon?utm_source=ghost&utm_medium=referral&utm_campaign=api-credit] 
/ Unsplash
[https://unsplash.com/?utm_source=ghost&utm_medium=referral&utm_campaign=api-credit]
A child with high self-esteem has following characteristics. If your child has
more than 6 characteristics below, you can think of him or her as having
high-esteem overall. 

No fear to have relationships with other people
They don’t have any fear of having relationships with other people. Children
with high self-esteem are not afraid to talk to new people because they are
confident that other people will also like themselves.

Empathy and consideration
Self-respect can also lead to others. They already know that the relationship
through empathy and consideration is very stable. It is because they learned the
attitude or method of maintaining a good relationship through the successful
relationships they have been through.

Kind and polite
They are kind and polite. They learn how to communicate with others by seeing
what other people are doing to them. They learn the kind and polite aspects they
have received, and they do it same.

Satisfaction
They know how to be satisfied with their achievements. Basically children do not
overconfident or underestimate their abilities. Children with well-developed
self-esteem know how to be purely happy with the achievements they have
achieved. Satisfaction with these achievements become the energy to challenge
new things.

New things
They have confidence and try new things well. They know how to be happy and
satisfied with his achievements. A feeling of joy makes them not afraid to take
on other challenges. they feel that challenging a new thing itself is not a
frightening thing but a joyful thing that gives you another joy.

Passionate
They try to do things proactively and proactively. When they do things, they
don't act passively and passively. They always try to be proactive and take the
initiative.

Positive way of thinking
They are not good at negative thoughts. They focus on the current situation.
What if this doesn't work? What if this goes wrong? Instead of being restless,
they enjoy and focus on the current situation. Even if they have negative
thoughts, they think they can quickly come up with a countermeasure or try
harder.

Positive words
They don't use pessimistic words well and words that deny reality or pessimistic
words. They express themselves with positive words.

Responsibility
They put the responsibility of work on themselves and think that they are
responsible for doing something. If they are making a big house out of blocks
and it doesn't work well, they think that they will just need a little more and
keep challenging or they guess they tried to make it too big. Then they will
think "shall we change it a little bit more?"

Never frustrated
They are not very frustrated if they fail something. Even if they fail and
suffer frustration, they won't get hurt very much. They just think of ways to
overcome failures. Because they know that with a little more effort, they can
experience other successes.

What about the level of self-esteem for my child, the belief that I can and love myself? Is my child a child with low self-esteem? A child with high self-esteem?
Take a closer look at the characteristics of a child with high self-esteem and think about what kind of child you are!

Child with high self-esteem

As discussed in the previous post of people with high esteem, the characteristics of people with high were listed and now we will look child with high self-esteem through and through in this post.

What about the level of self-esteem of your child? Is your child a child with high or low self-esteem? Is it a high child? Take a closer look at the characteristics of a child with high self-esteem and think about what kind of  your child is.

A child with high self-esteem has following characteristics. If your child has more than 6 characteristics below, you can think of him or her as having high-esteem overall.

No fear to have relationships with other people

They don’t have any fear of having relationships with other people. Children with high self-esteem are not afraid to talk to new people because they are confident that other people will also like themselves.

Empathy and consideration

Self-respect can also lead to others. They already know that the relationship through empathy and consideration is very stable. It is because they learned the attitude or method of maintaining a good relationship through the successful relationships they have been through.

Kind and polite

They are kind and polite. They learn how to communicate with others by seeing what other people are doing to them. They learn the kind and polite aspects they have received, and they do it same.

Satisfaction

They know how to be satisfied with their achievements. Basically children do not overconfident or underestimate their abilities. Children with well-developed self-esteem know how to be purely happy with the achievements they have achieved. Satisfaction with these achievements become the energy to challenge new things.

New things

They have confidence and try new things well. They know how to be happy and satisfied with his achievements. A feeling of joy makes them not afraid to take on other challenges. they feel that challenging a new thing itself is not a frightening thing but a joyful thing that gives you another joy.

Passionate

They try to do things proactively and proactively. When they do things, they don't act passively and passively. They always try to be proactive and take the initiative.

Positive way of thinking

They are not good at negative thoughts. They focus on the current situation. What if this doesn't work? What if this goes wrong? Instead of being restless, they enjoy and focus on the current situation. Even if they have negative thoughts, they think they can quickly come up with a countermeasure or try harder.

Positive words

They don't use pessimistic words well and words that deny reality or pessimistic words. They express themselves with positive words.

Responsibility

They put the responsibility of work on themselves and think that they are responsible for doing something. If they are making a big house out of blocks and it doesn't work well, they think that they will just need a little more and keep challenging or they guess they tried to make it too big. Then they will think "shall we change it a little bit more?"

Never frustrated

They are not very frustrated if they fail something. Even if they fail and suffer frustration, they won't get hurt very much. They just think of ways to overcome failures. Because they know that with a little more effort, they can experience other successes.

What is the result of the level of your child for self-esteem with above features? In the next post, the characteristics of child with low self-esteem will be introduced.
